action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a bed, a potion recipe, a book and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the floor. The potion recipe is on the bed. The book is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a reading room here.
action.label: context

action.content: You take the potion recipe. In your inventory you have a potion recipe.
action.label: context

action.content: You are in a reading room now. There are a couch, a chair, a side table, a table and a shelf. There are passages to a garden and a conservatory here.
action.label: context

action.content: You are in a garden now. There are a nightshade, a garden bench, a bucket of water and a lily of the valley. The nightshade is on the floor. The bucket of water is on the floor. The lily of the valley is on the floor. There are passages to a outhouse and a storage room here.
action.label: context

action.content: You take the nightshade. In your inventory you have a nightshade and a potion recipe.
action.label: context

action.content: You are in a storage room now. There are a plonkle crystal, a ladle, a borpulus, a spoon, a plunkle crystal, a crate, a plinkle crystal and a whisk. The plonkle crystal is on the floor. The ladle is on the floor. The borpulus is on the floor. The spoon is on the floor. The plunkle crystal is on the floor. The plinkle crystal is on the floor. The whisk is on the floor. There are passages to a cellar and a hallway here.
action.label: context

Magical experiments have reversed and dampened gravity in this room. You begin to float in the air.
